com.concordium.sdk

Class TLSConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.concordium.sdk.TLSConfig

  • public class TLSConfig
extends Object
    Configuration to be used for a TLS enforced Connection

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assertOk() 
      static TLSConfig auto()
      The underlying connection is forced to use TLS.

      Constructor for establishing a basic TLS connection.

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public static TLSConfig from(File serverCert)
        Constructor for establishing a basic TLS connection.
        Parameters:
        serverCert - The X509 certificate of the server.
        Returns:
        the TLSConfig

      • mTLS

        public static TLSConfig mTLS(File serverCert,
                             File clientCert,
                             File clientKeyFile)
        Constructor for establishing a mTLS connection.
        Parameters:
        serverCert - The pem encoded certificate of the server. Supply 'null' here if the default JVM trust store should be used for the connection.
        clientCert - The pem encoded certificate of the client
        clientKeyFile - The PEM encoded PKCS#8 private key for the client.
        Returns:
        the TLSConfig

      • auto

        public static TLSConfig auto()
        The underlying connection is forced to use TLS. Note. the servers certificate must be trusted by the default jks CA.

        See from(File) or mTLS(File, File, File) for configuring custom trust or mTLS.

        Returns:
        the TLSConfig

      • assertOk

        public void assertOk()

      • getServerCert

        public File getServerCert()
        The servers certificate or some CA that authorized it. See TlsChannelCredentials.Builder#trustManager(File) for details of the expected file format.

      • getClientCert

        public File getClientCert()
        If mTLS is to be used then this should be set to the certificate of the client. See TlsChannelCredentials.Builder#keyManager(File, File) for details of the expected file format.

      • getClientKeyFile

        public File getClientKeyFile()
        If mTLS is to be used then this should be set to the private key of the client. See TlsChannelCredentials.Builder#keyManager(File, File) for details of the expected file format.
